to the US where Atlanta mayor K

taking action police will now be

it angered me and it saddened me beyond

I
shinu I look forward to continuing to

well all this comes as president Trump

America correspondent Peter Bose
the president is planning to focus on
police misconduct and a big thrust of
this executive order is the setting up
of a national database effectively to
track those police officers who've been
guilty of misconduct and the idea seems
to be to stop those officers perhaps
they've been sacked from their jobs in
one district from moving around the
country and being re-employed another
aspect of this order is the
encouragement of police forces around
the country to deploy social workers to
work alongside police officers in
situations that are not violent so it
might be dealing with a drug case or
dealing with a situation involving
homelessness a situation that may
involve mental illness and that the main
thrust appears to be according to
officials in the White House to bring
the police
closer to communities and and quite
significantly this will not involve any
defunding of police forces and we've
heard about that of course in in

plan to effectively break down their

something else there's more

don't think it's the big step forward

well be critics and let's see what we

Republicans will be putting forward
